name: B. Race Against Time
statement:
Have you ever tried to explain to the coordinator, why it is eight hours
to the contest and not a single problem has been prepared yet? Misha
had. And this time he has a strong excuse: he faced a space-time
paradox! Space and time replaced each other.The entire universe turned
into an enormous clock face with three hands hour, minute, and second.
Time froze, and clocks now show the time hours, minutes, seconds.Last
time Misha talked with the coordinator at o’clock, so now he stands on
the number on the clock face. The contest should be ready by o’clock. In
the terms of paradox it means that Misha has to go to number somehow.
Note that he doesn’t have to move forward only: in these circumstances
time has no direction.Clock hands are very long, and Misha cannot get
round them. He also cannot step over as it leads to the collapse of
space-time. That is, if hour clock points 12 and Misha stands at 11 then
he cannot move to 1 along the top arc. He has to follow all the way
round the clock center (of course, if there are no other hands on his
way).Given the hands’ positions, , and , find if Misha can prepare the
contest on time (or should we say ?). That is, find if he can move from
to by the clock face.
